item.title: Reading os/exec.Cmd Output Without Race Conditions
item.description: Golang Weekly issue 164 features a nice article, Advanced command execution in Go with os/exec, which details several ways of working with os/exec, especially how to read STDOUT and STDERR while the command is running. This common task is commonly done wrong, where “wrong” means “the code has a race condition”. This blog post shows how to read STDOUT and STDERR from an os/exec.Cmd while it’s running and without race conditions.
